climbs.name: Snake skin boots
climbs.fa: David Tellechea, Aaron Davis, Brian Benedon

content.description: Once you are at the main base of the Pinnacles, hike around the base up and right and spot the first pitch chimney.   Pitch 1. Start in the chimney for 20 ft and step across to the face. Move up cracks and plates. Finally, traverse right  to a big boulder chockstone and belay here.  Pitch 2.  Starts on the big chickenhead plates then goes up and right into the main weakness of the tower. Hand jams , crimps and interesting foot work will get you to the crux of the route. On the FA, multiple gear was pulled out from this certain spot so a bolt was added to protect the moves. Once you are above the bolt, A small finger crack and hand cracks will appear again. Two bolt anchor on top for a single rope rap
content.protection: good selection of doubles in small/ mediums Cams and singles to 4/5 camalot
content.location: Around the corner to the right of the main area. Hard to miss it

content.description: Delicate climb with some fun movement. Takes some time to find good gear (and good rock) for protecting the moves. But does protect well. After more ascents and some major clean up, should be a nice route!
content.protection: Single rack to #4; bring your nuts! Bolted anchor for rapping.
content.location: Shorter wall to the right of Forked Tongue Tower. Follow the base of the cliff until you find a flat area with segmented walls. Route climbs the most obvious weakness in the middle of the wall, starting with a wide crack. Bolted anchor at a nice ledge.

content.description: This is a great little 2 pitch tower. A couple of routes have now been established here and Snake Skin Boots just might be the best route in the Rattlesnake Pinnacles area. We are sure we got the FA of this tower because of how much was trundled from the top. A single rope gets you up and down this tower and a fast rap route has been added.
